definition: to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success) (idiom)/abbr. for 過五關斬六將|过五关斩六将[guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4]
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan
to behead (as form of capital punishment)/to chop
to desire/to invite/to request
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
general/commander-in-chief (military)/king (chess piece)/to command/to lead

sentences.english: Uruguay lived up to its reputation and delighted the home fans by disposing of one team after another.
sentences.chinese: 乌拉圭队不负众望过关斩将，乡亲们都非常高兴。

sentences.english: The team we played against in 1999 was really powerful. It had strength all the way through.
sentences.chinese: 99年与我们交战的拜仁真的很强，一路过关斩将。

sentences.english: A good performance at a job interview can get you through the gate and past the gatekeeper.
sentences.chinese: 在工作面试中的好的表现可以使你过关斩将。

definition: to advance boldly/to push ahead vigorously
lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
to win as a result of tenacious effort/to fight off tough competition
to storm (a city etc)/to raid
to sweep everything before one/to be invincible (idiom)
(sports) top eight/quarterfinals
progress/to advance
(sports) semifinal or quarterfinal/to compete in a semifinal (or a quarterfinal)
to force one's way out of encirclement/to break through
to return in low spirits following a defeat or failure to achieve one's ambitions (idiom)
to take (after a struggle)/to wrest/to seize/to capture/to win (a trophy)
third in a race/bronze medalist
to advance in rank/promotion/advancement
to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
good result/success
the top four
